SKATER COLLECTION

Skateboarding culture has become increasingly popular worldwide in recent years. Shinpei Ueno and Alex Olson, both skaters who started out on the streets, are now active in multiple fields, including fashion, design, and film. This collection features their artworks drawn exclusively for UT and a newly developed T-shirt silhouette.

Shinpei Ueno
As well as overseeing TIGHTBOOTH PRODUCTION, he also skates for Evisen Skateboards as a pro skater. He has released many skateboarding videos, and his most well-known work, “LENZ II,” was highly acclaimed both in Japan and abroad. He works in a wide variety of fields, including direction for a skate shop and apparel brand, and production for numerous brands. “LENZ III,” which completes the TIGHTBOOTH skateboarding video trilogy, was released worldwide in November 2022.

© Shinpei Ueno

Alex Olson
Alex Olson is a creative from Los Angeles, California, best known for his professional skateboarding from 2007 to 2021. He’ s the founder of the two brands, Bianca Chandon and Call Me 917. Recently, he’ s moved back to Los Angeles from New York City. He wanted to be closer to family and surf in unbearably crowded lineups. Alex now spends his time working on his brands, commissioned designs, meditation workshops and making music for various clients.

© Alex Olson

This design is inspired by the film “Suzume" and uses the powerful symbol of a single doorway as its main graphic element. We also wanted to celebrate another motif from the film, the image of a key. We feature the key on the backside of the T-shirt, center placement as if suspended.

Makoto Shinkai

Born in Nagano Prefecture, Japan in 1973, Makoto Shinkai makes his commercial debut with the short film he produced on his own, “Voices of a Distant Star.” Since, he has gone onto direct films such as “The Place Promised in Our Early Days (2004),” “5 Centimeters per Second (2007),” “Children Who Chase Lost Voices (2011)” and “The Garden of Words (2013).” Finally, in 2016, he directs “Your Name,” an international sensation and social phenomenon in Japan, and quickly follows it up with “Weathering with You” in 2019, which set box office records in Japan. In November 2022, his latest film, “Suzume” will be shown in domestic movie theaters.

MAKOTO SHINKAI FILMS COLLECTION

Director Makoto Shinkai creates social phenomena with his delicate depictions of daily life and stirring dramatic stories. This special collection, only available at Uniqlo, will celebrate the upcoming release of his latest feature-length animated film, "Suzume".

© 2022 SNTFP

Logo for the lifestyle magazine Better Living. It is an elegant solution in the style that made Herb Lubalin’s work famous, a masterpiece that creates a cohesive shape that looks effortless despite the intricate design and the liberties he takes with some letter construction.

Legends of Graphics

This collection focuses on the roots of logos and typography, featuring legendary corporate logos and works by two American graphic designers. Enjoy the sophisticated designs of Paul Rand, a master of "logo design," and Herb Lubalin, a pioneer of "typography".

Herb Lubalin
Renowned American graphic designer and typographer fascinated by the look and sound of words. He pioneered conceptual typography which he called "Graphic Expressionism," and created expressive "Word Pictures."

©️Herb Lubalin

Logo designed by Paul Rand for an IBM poster in support of IBM "THINK" motto. The "I" is represented by an eye and the "B" by a bee. This rebus is a masterpiece that can be said to be an iconic part of corporate logos visual history.

Legends of Graphics

This collection focuses on the roots of logos and typography, featuring legendary corporate logos and works by two American graphic designers. Enjoy the sophisticated designs of Paul Rand, a master of "logo design," and Herb Lubalin, a pioneer of "typography".

Paul Rand
An American graphic designer representing the 20th century. He has won numerous awards for his advertising and book designs, and his works are permanently preserved in museums around the world, including the United States, Europe, and Japan. Among his works, many of his corporate logos, including those of IBM, are well known throughout the world.

© IBM Corp. 1981.
The IBM Rebus logo is a registered trademark of IBM Corp. in the US and other countries.

items.longDescription:
Yusuke Hanai

Yusuke Hanai is a renowned graphic artist known for his unique style, heavily influenced by the counterculture of the '50s and '60s. He seamlessly blends Japanese aesthetic sensibility with retro American illustration. This collection of graphic T-shirts is based on the theme of "ONE STEP FORWARD," promoting environmentally conscious actions, and features his latest artwork printed on fabric made from recycled polyester.

Yusuke Hanai
Born in 1978, Yusuke Hanai is a globally recognized artist, having exhibited his works in various countries including the United States, France, Australia, Brazil, Taiwan, England. His style, characterized by its cynical and humorous storytelling, has garnered widespread attention both in Japan and internationally.

© Yusuke Hanai

This collection features their artworks drawn exclusively for UT and a newly developed T-shirt silhouette.

Alex Olson
Alex Olson is a creative from Los Angeles, California, best known for his professional skateboarding from 2007 to 2021. He’ s the founder of the two brands, Bianca Chandon and Call Me 917. Recently, he’ s moved back to Los Angeles from New York City. He wanted to be closer to family and surf in unbearably crowded lineups. Alex now spends his time working on his brands, commissioned designs, meditation workshops and making music for various clients.

© Alex Olson

Yusuke Hanai

Yusuke Hanai is a renowned graphic artist known for his unique style, heavily influenced by the counterculture of the '50s and '60s. He seamlessly blends Japanese aesthetic sensibility with retro American illustration. This collection of graphic T-shirts is based on the theme of "ONE STEP FORWARD," promoting environmentally conscious actions, and features his latest artwork printed on fabric made from recycled polyester.

Yusuke Hanai
Born in 1978, Yusuke Hanai is a globally recognized artist, having exhibited his works in various countries including the United States, France, Australia, Brazil, Taiwan, England. His style, characterized by its cynical and humorous storytelling, has garnered widespread attention both in Japan and internationally.

© Yusuke Hanai

items.longDescription:
The Message

T-shirts often reflect the thoughts, and trends of our times. Long before social media, T-shirts were a canvas on which people everywhere could freely express their messages. We returned to the origin of the graphic T-shirt and collaborated with three contemporary artists who lead the art scene in the U.S. and London.

Lakwena
Lakwena means 'messenger of the chief' in the northern Ugandan language of Acholi. Born in 1986, Lakwena's name is reflected in her artistic practice, which is primarily focused on messages. Utilizing bright color and bold text, Lakwena creates eye-catching and instantly recognizable paintings which can be understood to be "escape routes, afrofuturistic portals to utopia".

©LAKWENA

UT ARCHIVE Andy Warhol / Keith Haring / Jean-Michel Basquiat

“UT Archive” is a project that revives carefully selected T-shirts which have been sold in the past. From the UT collection that has been on sale for about 20 years, popular patterns by Andy Warhol, Basquiat, and Keith Haring will be re-released.

Andy Warhol
As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning.

Jean-Michel Basquiat
An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events.

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.
© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
© Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.

items.longDescription:
Graphic design inspired by the Wind God and Thunder God hanging scrolls by the great painter and woodblock artist Kawanabe Kyōsai (1831–1889).
In Japanese mythology, the Wind God wields a cloth bag that unleashes torrential wind and rain. Since ancient times, the Wind God has been revered for its ability to calm typhoons and storms that wreak havoc on crops.
This T-shirt depicts the mighty Wind God on a background the color of traditional Japanese persimmon-dyed textiles.

Japanese Art from the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston

The Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, is one of the premier art institutions in the world. The museum is renowned for its vast collection of Japanese artwork and long history of cultural exchange with Japan. A selection of the museum’s masterworks from Japan can now be enjoyed in a new collaboration with UNIQLO, inspired by iconic designs including Kawanabe Kyōsai’s Wind God and Thunder God, Hasegawa Tōhaku’s Dragon and Tiger.

MFABoston

items.longDescription:
In 1959, The Museum of Modern Art acquired Claude Monet’s Water Lilies triptych (1914-26), now a highlight of the Museum’s collection. Monet had worked on the monumental triptych for several years, building up the paint in layer after layer to create this shimmering surface of pink lilies, scudding clouds, and tranquil water. Here we see the painting being installed at MoMA for the first time, in a gallery that would become one of the Museum’s most immersive, meditative rooms.

This “Average Day at the Museum” diagram was created in 1939 to celebrate the opening of The Museum of Modern Art’s new custom-built home on West 53rd Street. In the building’s cross-section, we see various activities taking place: members lounging in the penthouse, films screening in the auditorium, books circulating through the library—and of course, visitors in the galleries exploring MoMA’s renowned collection of modern and contemporary art. West 53rd Street is MoMA’s address to this day.

The Message

T-shirts often reflect the thoughts, and trends of our times. Long before social media, T-shirts were a canvas on which people everywhere could freely express their messages. We returned to the origin of the graphic T-shirt and collaborated with three contemporary artists who lead the art scene in the U.S. and London.

Cali Dewitt
Cali Dewitt lives and works at Zuma Beach CA. He describes himself as a "multi-dimensional being" and tells us that he feels like he will be turning 100 next year. Dewitt is an artist and a designer, who has been exhibiting his work worldwide for the past decade, in addition to doing design work for cultural luminaries of the era.

© Cali Dewitt

Born in Tokyo in 1984. Moved to the United States in 2007, and currently based in Brooklyn. Meguru Yamaguchi focuses on brushstroke techniques, which have been a quintessential element of painting through times, and he expresses them out of canvas limitations, letting brushstrokes exist solely in space. His signature series “OUT OF BOUNDS” is further explored by the artist recently, to work on his first three-dimensional sculpture series to visualize energies of the self, nature and environment, the earth or the sun.

items.longDescription:
The Message

T-shirts often reflect the thoughts, and trends of our times. Long before social media, T-shirts were a canvas on which people everywhere could freely express their messages. We returned to the origin of the graphic T-shirt and collaborated with three contemporary artists who lead the art scene in the U.S. and London.

Trevor Andrew
Trevor Andrew is a former professional snowboarder who is known today as a fine artist and digital designer featuring his signature motifs and monograms. Andrew's artistic appropriation of consumer culture fuses pop art sensibility with skateboard culture aesthetics. His works have been exhibited in V&A Museum London, Modern Art Museum, Shanghai and Jeffrey Deitch gallery NY.

Trevor Andrew

items.shortDescription: A lineup of caps filled with messages from three contemporary artists.

items.longDescription:
The Message

T-shirts often reflect the thoughts, and trends of our times. Long before social media, T-shirts were a canvas on which people everywhere could freely express their messages. We returned to the origin of the graphic T-shirt and collaborated with three contemporary artists who lead the art scene in the U.S. and London.

Lakwena
Lakwena means 'messenger of the chief' in the northern Ugandan language of Acholi. Born in 1986, Lakwena's name is reflected in her artistic practice, which is primarily focused on messages. Utilizing bright color and bold text, Lakwena creates eye-catching and instantly recognizable paintings which can be understood to be "escape routes, afrofuturistic portals to utopia".

©LAKWENA

Cali Dewitt
Cali Dewitt lives and works at Zuma Beach CA. He describes himself as a "multi-dimensional being" and tells us that he feels like he will be turning 100 next year. Dewitt is an artist and a designer, who has been exhibiting his work worldwide for the past decade, in addition to doing design work for cultural luminaries of the era.

© Cali Dewitt

Hypebeast is a global media platform that focuses on the progression of culture. The collection features graphics that are made exclusively for UT and a newly developed T-shirt silhouette.

FaZe Clan
FaZe Clan is a digital-native lifestyle and media platform rooted in gaming and youth culture, reimagining traditional entertainment for the next generation. Founded in 2010 by a group of kids on the internet, FaZe Clan was created for and by Gen Z and Millennials, and today operates across multiple verticals. FaZe Clan’s roster of more than 100 influential personalities consists of engaging content creators, esports professionals, world-class gamers and a mix of talent who go beyond the world of gaming.
